title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define the project scope, objectives, and requirements by gathering input from stakeholders, including managers, employees, and subject matter experts.

title: System Architecture Design
description: Design the overall system architecture for the FeedbackLoopOptimizer project. Focus on a modular, scalable, and maintainable structure. The design should include the feedback loop workflow, data models, integration with existing systems, edge cases handling, error management, performance optimizations, and adherence to security best practices (e.g., encryption, authentication, and authorization). Address data privacy concerns, comply with relevant regulations (e.g., GDPR), plan for potential scalability issues by considering future growth, and provide documentation for each component of the system architecture. Consider involving the Data Privacy Officer in discussions regarding user data handling to ensure compliance.

title: Database Design and Implementation
description: Design and implement the database schema to store feedback data, user information, and other relevant data.

title: Backend Development
description: Develop the server-side components, including APIs, business logic, and integration with other systems.

title: Frontend Development
description: Develop the user interfaces for managers, employees, and administrators, ensuring a seamless and intuitive experience.

title: Security and Access Control (Updated)
description:
Implement appropriate security measures, including authentication, authorization, and data encryption, to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of feedback data. This should include, but not be limited to, the following:

1. User authentication using industry-standard protocols (e.g., OAuth, OpenID Connect) and secure password storage (e.g., salted and hashed with bcrypt).
2. Role-based access control (RBAC) to restrict access to sensitive data and functionality based on user roles and permissions, implementing least privilege principle.
3. Data encryption at rest (e.g., using AES-256 in XTS mode) and in transit (e.g., using TLS/SSL with forward secrecy).
4. Secure communication channels (e.g., HTTPS over QUIC) for all data transmissions.
5. Regular security audits, penetration testing, and vulnerability assessments to identify and mitigate vulnerabilities.
6. Adherence to relevant security standards and best practices (e.g., OWASP Top Ten, NIST SP 800-53).
7. Implement a secure logging mechanism for audit trails and incident response. In addition, consider implementing multi-factor authentication and regular security training for users.
8. Ensure the system complies with all applicable privacy laws and regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop and execute comprehensive test plans, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance tests, to ensure the system meets the defined requirements and functions as expected.

title: Deployment and DevOps
description: Set up the deployment environment, including infrastructure provisioning, continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, and monitoring and logging systems.

title: Documentation and User Training
description: Create comprehensive documentation, including user guides, administration manuals, and training materials, to support the adoption and effective use of the system.
